intro: Genista dracunculoides, commonly known as the creeping yellow broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its shrub-like form and hardy nature make it a resilient plant in Mediterranean climates.
